intro: Erasanthe henrici subsp. isaloensis, commonly known as the Isalo erasanthe, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has delicate, hairy leaves and thrives in moist, shaded environments within its endemic habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its botanical significance lies in its unique adaptations and role in the local ecosystem.
